poem:
Title: "Ode to a Green Cake Divine"

A soft poem rests in this pastel-green round,
of curious tastes that merrily confound.
Vanilla whispers secrets to spirited lime,
and dill attends silently, marking time.
Graced with icing, zingy and sweet,
the quiet rhythm of flavors we shall meet.
Sliced, with lime's wedges close at hand,
savor the meaning, wordlessly grand.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Philip Khoury’s recipes for vanilla, lime and dill tea cake | The sweet spot I call this tea cake the VLD: vanilla, lime and dill. It is a moist, round sponge with a gentle infusion of its eponymous ingredients, which together give it a beautiful, pastel-green colour. On top, I drizzle a zingy lime and vanilla bean icing, before serving with lime wedges for extra zing. Vanilla lime dill tea cake Prep 10 minBake 35-40". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
